Key Match Events: Kazim La√ßi scored an 11th-minute header for Albania's lead
Andrej Kramaric equalized for Croatia in the 74th minute
Klaus Gjasula scored an own goal in the 76th minute
Klaus Gjasula equalized for Albania with a side-footed goal in added time
Pre-Game Insights: Both countries now have a single point after their opening two matches and are left effectively needing to win their last group games on Monday if they are to progress into the knockout stage
No team has made the next round with just two draws since the Euro finals expanded to 24 teams in 2016 -- offering a place in the last-16 to the four best third-placed finishers
Post-Match Reflections: Kramaric said 'This is why everyone loves football. In the last seconds, sometimes you score a goal to win, sometimes you concede'
Gjasula said 'We know that the game with Spain is very difficult but in football everything is possible. If we will play like today everything can happen'
Croatia coach Zlatko Dalic said 'The first half was very bad but the second much better, which is encouraging for the match with Italy'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played to a backdrop of ear-splitting noise
Albania's gritty determination -- and the speed with which they seized counterattacking opportunities -- belied their lowly ranking, some 56 places below 10th placed Croatia
Others: The match was played at the Volksparkstadion in Hamburg, Germany
